title: Shakespeare's Globe On Screen Julius Caesar (2014)
description:
Shakespeare's Globe On Screen Julius Caesar (2015)
from Opus Arte Productions - Naxxos USA

Optional English subtitles available from your player

Run time  151 min. presented in two parts at act break.

IMDb  none issued

Summary

A live performance of the play "Julius Caesar" by William Shakespeare. Set in ancient Rome, leading citizens Cassius and Marcus Brutus are alarmed that the power and authority Caesar is assuming may endanger the democracy of the Republic, so they conspire to assassinate the popular general. The ensuing battles and suicides extend the tragedy, establishing neither a clear-cut hero nor villain.

My notes:

  The Julius Caesar from the Globe like Titus Andronicus is another of the Roman plays. Antony and Cleopatra was also recently done by the Globe and will be part of this series of my fileshares.  The history dramas are presented in a more straightforward manner.  And of course Julius Caesar has some of the great scenes such as the funeral oration and what have become popular cliches of speech.  Julius Caesar is the source of the phrase 'it was all Greek to me.'  A big line for the audience to appreciate.

  For comparison,  in my collection is the Royal Shakespeare Company's production of this play directed by Gregory Doran.  That is a non-traditional interpretation but a great experience of the play.  I'll not give away more about it.  It's on the 'Bay in my collection.

  A note of appreciation to those who are seeding these Globe productions so that others might enjoy them and get the dvds for their libraries at schools and universities.  Please join me in keeping them going as long as possible, preferably for years to come.

 The dvds vary in how many subtitle translations they have and I try to include all in recent efforts.  This one has English subtitles from the original available to your player.
